Here at Team Rounds, our former interns are doing some awesome things, and we want to highlight them! Meet Kaelyn Somsen of Webster:

What did you learn in your internship that has helped you through the rest of your college career?  “I learned many valuable things during my time interning in Senator Rounds' office. I continue to use many of those lessons during my time in law school and while working in a law firm. Communication is a big part of interning in the Senate, whether it be communicating with constituents, those who are coming in to meet with the Senator, or other staff members. Learning how to address different people and situations has helped me in school and work as I am able to communicate efficiently and effectively with clients, professors, attorneys, and other staff members. I also enjoyed getting to learn about the legislative process and feel that knowledge has helped me understand the legislative side of the laws I am learning in school. I could go on and on about the things I learned while interning as I gained so much knowledge and experience during my short time in DC.”

Is there a memory from your internship that still sticks out to you? “I have so many memories from my internship, but some of my favorites were getting to go with Senator Rounds to meet with people from my hometown or running into people I knew around the capital. Here at Team Rounds, our former interns are doing some awesome things, and we want to highlight them! Meet Sara Hofer of Salem:

What did you learn in your internship that has helped you through the rest of your college career? 
“One thing I learned throughout the summer internship is adaptability and the value of asking questions. Senator Rounds’ office has many constituent services and legislative responsibilities that ensure all tasks are done efficiently and on time. Adapting to situations, asking clarifying questions, and critically listening to staff and constituents’ requests has helped me become a better student by encouraging me to grow in the comfort that not knowing everything right away is okay. Asking questions helps you better understand what is required of you to complete any task to the best of your ability, which has helped me throughout my entire college experience.”

Is there a memory from your internship that still sticks out to you?
